title: God
main_text:
Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting. Ralph Waldo Emerson

The Answer by Rudyard Kipling

I Heard a Fly Buzz-When I Died by Emily Dickinson

God's Grandeur by Gerard Manley Hopkins

I Wake and Feel the Fell of Dark, Not Day by Gerard Manley Hopkins

They Are All Gone Into the World of Light! by Henry Vaughan

The World by Henry Vaughan

The Water-Fall by Henry Vaughan

next to of course god america I by E. E. Cummings

The Cry of the Children by Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Holy Sonnet XIV: Batter my Heart, Three-Personed God by John Donne

Epigram by Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Frost at Midnight by Samuel Taylor Coleridge

The Lime-Tree Bower, my Prision by Samuel Taylor Coleridge

God Sees the Truth, but Waits by Leo Tolstoy
